content:
• Wednesday, December 19, 2012
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) are active in the post session on speculation that Johnson &...

    Shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) are active in the post session on speculation that Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) and AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) are considering a takeover of the drug developer due to the company's obesity drug Qsymia. Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) may also take an interest should VVUS come under takeover attack, because obestity drugs are a hot item at present - with over 78M obese adults in the U.S. alone. Deal-watchers are skeptical however, noting that any deal with a chance of success would need to be in the $30-plus per share range. VVUS +1.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • SD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SD +8%. APOL +7%. TTWO +6%. JBL +6%. GNCMA...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SD +8%. APOL +7%. TTWO +6%. JBL +6%. GNCMA +5%.
    After-hours top losers: FOLD -52%. RGR -7%. VRTX -6%. HMA -5%. ACN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • ENDP

    Endo Health (NASDAQ:ENDP) says the U.S. District Court has ruled against its bid to stop sales...

    Endo Health (NASDAQ:ENDP) says the U.S. District Court has ruled against its bid to stop sales of generic versions of its painkiller Opana ER, saying the FDA has not unduly delayed making a determination on the matter as to whether the original formulation was withdrawn from the market for reasons of safety. The ruling now allows for a generic non-tamper resistant version to enter the market in January, 2013. Shares -3.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • BKR

    Michael Baker Corp. (NYSEMKT:BKR) shareholder DC Capital Partners offers to acquire the...

    Michael Baker Corp. (NYSEMKT:BKR) shareholder DC Capital Partners offers to acquire the engineering company for $24.25/share. BKR +3.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • WMC

    Western Asset Mortgage Capital (NYSE:WMC) declares $0.90/share quarterly dividend, 5.9% increase...

    Western Asset Mortgage Capital (NYSE:WMC) declares $0.90/share quarterly dividend, 5.9% increase from prior dividend of $0.85. Forward yield 17.2%. For shareholders of record Dec. 31. Payable Jan. 29. Ex-div date Dec. 27. Additionally, the board declares special dividend of $0.22/share payable with regular dividend. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • FOLD

    Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) and GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) announce results from the Phase...

    Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) and GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) announce results from the Phase III study of its investigational oral migalastat HCl monotherapy in patients with Fabry disease, noting the pre-designated primary endpoint was not achieved. FOLD -50%, GSK -0.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • CRDS

    Crossroads Systems (NASDAQ:CRDS): FQ4 EPS of -$0.23 in-line. Revenue of $4.4M (-29% Y/Y)...

    Crossroads Systems (NASDAQ:CRDS): FQ4 EPS of -$0.23 in-line. Revenue of $4.4M (-29% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD) +9.2% AH after agreeing to sell its Permian assets to Sheridan...

    SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD) +9.2% AH after agreeing to sell its Permian assets to Sheridan Production Partners for $2.6B. SD says the sale is a key part of its planned strategic transition from a natural gas producer to an oil rich E&P company, and results in a cash balance of nearly $3B and liquidity of more than $3.5B for debt reduction and funding development of its Mississippian play.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): FQ3 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $2.59B misses...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): FQ3 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $2.59B misses by $140M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +6.9%) finishes the day with another solid gain; shares are now up 35% since...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +6.9%) finishes the day with another solid gain; shares are now up 35% since the struggling telecom equipment vendor announced its debt refinancing deal. The Fool's Rich Smith recently suggested investors remain cautious, given Alcatel burned $386.5M in cash in Q3 and pledged a patent portfolio estimated to be worth ~$6.5B as collateral (among other things) to secure its financing. (yesterday)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ACN

    Accenture (NYSE:ACN): FQ1 EPS of $1.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.22B (+2% Y/Y) misses by...

    Accenture (NYSE:ACN): FQ1 EPS of $1.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.22B (+2% Y/Y) misses by $70M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • SNY

    Sanofi (SNY -1.7%) agrees to pay $109M to resolve allegations that its U.S. subsidiary violated...

    Sanofi (SNY -1.7%) agrees to pay $109M to resolve allegations that its U.S. subsidiary violated the False Claims Act by giving physicians free units of Hyalgan, a knee injection, in an attempt to induce them to purchase and prescribe the product. The settlement also resolves allegations that Sanofi US submitted false average sales price reports for Hyalgan that failed to account for the free units that were distributed contingent on Hyalgan purchases, which caused government programs to pay inflated amounts.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • PDH

    PetroLogistics (PDH -2.4%) announced earlier that it shut its propane dehydrogenation facility...

    PetroLogistics (PDH -2.4%) announced earlier that it shut its propane dehydrogenation facility in Texas for unscheduled repairs as a result of damage to a compressor; the partnership believes all repairs can be completed in three weeks at a cost of ~$2M. It is PDH's only facility, a factor IPO Candy cites in his negative view of the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • EPL

    EPL Oil & Gas (EPL +2%) is raised to Buy from Accumulate with a $28 price target...

    EPL Oil & Gas (EPL +2%) is raised to Buy from Accumulate with a $28 price target (from $25) at Global Hunter, which cites EPL's opportune hedging of Brent-linked crude at prices above $100/bbl and above the firm's $95/bbl blended realization estimate. The firm also sees EPL's 2013 drilling expectations as conservative, offering additional potential upside for shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF -11.9%) CEO Michael Johnson responds to Bill Ackman's accusation that the company...

    Herbalife (HLF -11.9%) CEO Michael Johnson responds to Bill Ackman's accusation that the company is a 'pyramid scheme' countering that Ackman is improperly trying to manipulate Herbalife's stock and the SEC should take action. Johnson says company is a legitimate business with "millions of customers" and real business model. Ackman's short is about his own business model, not about HLF's. (video)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 16 Comments
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -14.5%) take a hit coming off a trading halt and move toward a fresh...

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -14.5%) take a hit coming off a trading halt and move toward a fresh 52-week low after hedge fund manager Bill Ackman told CNBC that he is "short" the shares, calling the company a "pyramid scheme."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 24 Comments
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI -58.7%) has resumed trading following news of its bankruptcy filing: shares have...

    THQ (THQI -58.7%) has resumed trading following news of its bankruptcy filing: shares have plunged to a mere $0.57. The debt-laden company says Chap. 11 filing is accompanied by a deal to sell "substantially all" of its operating assets to P-E firm Clearlake Capital for a total consideration of $60M (includes a $10M note for THQ's creditors). THQ has also obtained $37.5M in debtor-in-possession financing from Clearlake and Wells Fargo.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • CBMX

    Shares of Combimatrix (CBMX -3.6%) slip today after the companys says in a filing that it issued...

    Shares of Combimatrix (CBMX -3.6%) slip today after the companys says in a filing that it issued 427,878 shares to accredited investors following the conversion of its Series A 6% convertible preferred stock, generating about $855,000 in proceeds.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +4%) says it aims to cut costs by 32B reais ($15.4B) during 2013-16 by targeting...

    Petrobras (PBR +4%) says it aims to cut costs by 32B reais ($15.4B) during 2013-16 by targeting a range of objectives in its upstream, downstream and power segments. PBR is seeking to cut costs and boost revenue after a decline in output, a government fuel-price freeze, soaring prices for offshore oil development and rising debt put its $235B 2012-16 investment plan at risk.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • NEPT

    Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +18%) bounces back after two days of heavy...

    Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +18%) bounces back after two days of heavy losses, on the back of comments from its CFO that the company expects to resume production of its nutritional supplements next year, with another factory coming on line in about six months. The company's plant in Sherbrooke was destroyed in November by an explosion and fire, killing three workers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • EA

    Though they're not having as bad of a day as THQ, major game developers have been selling off...

    Though they're not having as bad of a day as THQ, major game developers have been selling off today - EA -2.4%, ATVI -2.3%, TTWO -4% - and so has GameStop (GME -1.2%). Growing political scrutiny of violent video games in the wake of the Connecticut shooting seems to be the culprit. Shooter Adam Lanza was apparently a fan of the Call of Duty series.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI -10.1%) is filing for bankruptcy protection. The video game developer's survival has...

    THQ (THQI -10.1%) is filing for bankruptcy protection. The video game developer's survival has been in doubt thanks to plunging sales, game delays, and heavy credit facility borrowings. Shares spiked lower to $1.22 before getting halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • FMCN

    Focus Media (FMCN +6.9%) remains in a trading halt that has traders scratching their heads. If a...

    Focus Media (FMCN +6.9%) remains in a trading halt that has traders scratching their heads. If a WSJ report tipping off the company is close to approving a $27.50-a-share buyout offer is accurate, "let's get on with it" appears to be the sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • ISRG

    Shares of Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -3.4%) get smacked by a Citron Research report that questions...

    Shares of Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -3.4%) get smacked by a Citron Research report that questions the stocks lofty valuation, and claims the stock is a one trick pony without any real edge and the company facing a host of lawsuits.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 9 Comments
  • AMPL

    Midday top 10 gainers: AMPL +119%. DYNT +64%. EDAP +25%. ALTE +24%. STP +16%. PTNR +13%. LDK...

    Midday top 10 gainers: AMPL +119%. DYNT +64%. EDAP +25%. ALTE +24%. STP +16%. PTNR +13%. LDK +12%. GBR +19%. CSUN +12%. ELTK +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ONTY -54%. CMGE -21%. PLXT -18%. NICK -15%. DLB -12%. PNTR -11%. PSDV -10%. EGLE -10%. OTC:CCUR -10%. PTEK -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GE

    General Electric (GE -2.7%) dips today after UBS removed the stock from its U.S. Key Call list...

    General Electric (GE -2.7%) dips today after UBS removed the stock from its U.S. Key Call list today, citing expectations for weaker than expected near-term earnings growth and an uncertain macro environment.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 17 Comments
  • PBR

    Brazil's national development bank BNDES approves a 2.2B real ($1.1B) loan to help finance the...

    Brazil's national development bank BNDES approves a 2.2B real ($1.1B) loan to help finance the construction of a fertilizer plant by state-run Petrobras (PBR +3.9%). PBR is building Brazil's biggest fertilizer plant in the state of Mato Grosso do Sul; the plant is set to begin operations in 2014. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • JCP

    A report of a new hire by J.C. Penney (JCP +5.6%) helps kickstart a rally in shares and...

    A report of a new hire by J.C. Penney (JCP +5.6%) helps kickstart a rally in shares and bring some buyers back into the fold. The retailer landed Abercrombie & Fitch exec Bradon Tonniges to help with store design and layout, according to Bloomberg. The exec was one of the brains behind the transition of Abercrombie stores into a dark nightclub atmosphere.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 7 Comments
  • BX

    Physician staffing company Team Health Holding (TMH - 3.6%) trades lower after pricing its 8M...

    Physician staffing company Team Health Holding (TMH - 3.6%) trades lower after pricing its 8M share secondary offering at $28.95, a 3.4% discount to yesterday's close. Ensemble Parent LLC, an affiliate of Blackstone Group (BX +1.0%), sold the shares, and still to owns around 15% of the float.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • OAK

    Oaktree Capital (OAK +2.4%) takes out a new YTD high as Goldman reiterates its Buy rating and...

    Oaktree Capital (OAK +2.4%) takes out a new YTD high as Goldman reiterates its Buy rating and raises the price target to $58 from $55. Following a $1.26B distribution to investors in the Opportunities Fund, Oaktree shareholders in 2013 are about to witness the joys of incentive income.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • ORCL

    Some enterprise software names are rallying in the wake of Oracle's (ORCL +3.4%) FQ2 beat, which...

    Some enterprise software names are rallying in the wake of Oracle's (ORCL +3.4%) FQ2 beat, which was fueled by strong software license sales. VMW +3.7%. WDAY +2.9%. SPLK +2.6%. INFA +2.2%. JIVE +3.5%. Also, Mellanox (MLNX +4.9%) is getting a lift from the strong performance of Oracle's engineered systems business. Oracle noted on its earnings call its app license growth was north of 30%. Goldman estimates total license growth received a 600 bps boost from acquisitions, but is still impressed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil and Gas (COG +1.7%) says its Marcellus operations surpassed 1B cubic ft./day of gross...

    Cabot Oil and Gas (COG +1.7%) says its Marcellus operations surpassed 1B cubic ft./day of gross production for the first time vs. ~780M cubic ft./day in late October. COG also says it agrees to sell four South Texas fields to an undisclosed third party for ~$29M. The production news prompts Ladenberg Thalmann to raise its price target to $58 from $54.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • SYMM

    Symmetricom (SYMM -8.2%) slips after lowering its FQ2 earnings and revenue guidance, due in part...

    Symmetricom (SYMM -8.2%) slips after lowering its FQ2 earnings and revenue guidance, due in part to weak U.S. government spending. It now sees an EPS loss of $0.05 to $0.11 on revenue of $46M to $49M, below its previous guidance of $55M to $62M. Symmetricom provides products, like atomic clocks, that help keep time for the communications, defense and IT industries.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX +3.1%) and Western Digital (WDC +4.1%) pop after receiving upgrades to Buy from...

    Seagate (STX +3.1%) and Western Digital (WDC +4.1%) pop after receiving upgrades to Buy from Craig-Hallum. The firm cites hard drive inventory reductions and lower expectations, and a lack of pricing changes. Judging by their current valuations, investor expectations for STX and WDC are definitely quite low. JPMorgan downgraded Seagate last week, while Barron's named both companies to its list of top 10 picks for 2013. Hard drive controller supplier Marvell (MRVL +1.9%) is also up.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • PDCE

    PDC Energy (PDCE -2%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Canaccord, which says shares are...

    PDC Energy (PDCE -2%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Canaccord, which says shares are overbought on investor enthusiasm over PDCE's Utica Shale leasehold in Ohio. Limited petrophysical and well data suggest productivity of the Point Pleasant formation across the southern 75% of PDCE's Utica leasehold is highly uncertain, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM

  • Oil goes vertical following the EIA report, which showed an essentially inline draw on reserves....

    Oil goes vertical following the EIA report, which showed an essentially inline draw on reserves. WTI crude is now +1.7% at $89.89/barrel. There is chatter Russia has evacuated its citizens from Syria.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 3 Comments
  • IDRA

    Idera Pharmaceuticals (IDRA +25.8%) ramps higher out of the gate after saying that its lead drug...

    Idera Pharmaceuticals (IDRA +25.8%) ramps higher out of the gate after saying that its lead drug candidate IMO-3100, a treatment for moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis, was more effective than a placebo in a Phase IIa clinical trial of two dose levels. The company thinks the trial data for the injectable treatment provides clinical proof-of-concept for the mechanism that suppresses certain factors that underlie the skin disorder.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • YPF

    Argentina's YPF (YPF -5.8%) sold 3.6B pesos ($736M) yesterday in its largest ever sale in the...

    Argentina's YPF (YPF -5.8%) sold 3.6B pesos ($736M) yesterday in its largest ever sale in the local bond market, pushing its issuance to a record 9.4B pesos this year and crowding out other companies looking to borrow. YPF hasn’t sold debt in overseas bond markets since the government expropriated it from Repsol.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -4.2%) increases the 9M-share public offering to fund the recent purchase...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -4.2%) increases the 9M-share public offering to fund the recent purchase of Utica shale acreage to 11M, pricing the offering at $38/share, plus a $50M bond add-on. However, Wunderlich likes the acquisition, raising its share price target to $48 from $44 on improved Utica exposure, higher 2013 production levels and expected growth going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • LDK

    Chinese solar stocks rally after the State Council says it wants to encourage solar M&A...

    Chinese solar stocks rally after the State Council says it wants to encourage solar M&A activity in a bid to reform the struggling industry. The council adds it wants to reduce government support (previous), and suggests it's willing to let companies go bankrupt. Consolidation, something Beijing has long hinted it would support, would help the industry address its huge overcapacity problem, and perhaps also foreign anti-dumping complaints. LDK +11.1%. YGE +9.3%. JASO +3.3%. CSIQ +6.5%. TSL +5.5%. JKS +4.5%. STP +7.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • HEB

    Hemispherx Biopharma (NYSEMKT:HEB) sinks 11.4% after the FDA yesterday placed strong doubts on...

    Hemispherx Biopharma (NYSEMKT:HEB) sinks 11.4% after the FDA yesterday placed strong doubts on the the safety and effectiveness of the company's Ampligen treatment for chronic fatigue syndrome. The critique comes ahead of a meeting tomorrow in which an FDA advisory panel will decide whether or not to recommend that the agency authorize the treatment. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • FMCN

    Trading on Focus Media (FMCN +6.9%) is currently halted with rumors out that a raised offer for...

    Trading on Focus Media (FMCN +6.9%) is currently halted with rumors out that a raised offer for the company is in the works.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • PLXT

    PLX Technology (PLXT -15.4%) tumbled and IDT (IDTI +4%) spikes higher on news the FTC has filed...

    PLX Technology (PLXT -15.4%) tumbled and IDT (IDTI +4%) spikes higher on news the FTC has filed a complaint challenging the companies' planned merger. The agency is concerned about the 85%+ share the combined company would have in the PCI-Express switch market. Back in April, IDT agreed to buy PLX for $3.50 in cash and 0.525 shares for every PLX share outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • PEIX

    Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +2.3%) moves to increase ownership interest in its plants and improve...

    Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +2.3%) moves to increase ownership interest in its plants and improve their debt position. PEIX secures extended maturity of its revolving credit line to 2015, agrees to purchase $21.5M in plant debt to be extended to 2016, and will purchase an additional 13% interest in the plants to increase its ownership interest to 80%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • RSH

    RadioShack (RSH +2.7%) trades higher after the company fills a couple of key positions....

    RadioShack (RSH +2.7%) trades higher after the company fills a couple of key positions. Though the company sees the ominichannel experience of the new hires as a positive, expect bears to view the development as more deck chairs getting swapped on the Titanic.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (SIRI +0.2%) trades higher with word out that it found someone to call the shots...

    Sirius XM Radio (SIRI +0.2%) trades higher with word out that it found someone to call the shots for Mel Karmazin on an interim basis. An important backdrop for the company is where auto sales will come in at for December. Typically, the last week of the year is a big selling period, but the fiscal cliff paranoia adds a wildcard to the mix this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • DLPH

    Delphi Automotive (NYSE:DLPH) +4.4% premarket after S&P announces it will replace Titanium...

    Delphi Automotive (NYSE:DLPH) +4.4% premarket after S&P announces it will replace Titanium Metals (TIE) in the S&P 500 index after the close of trading Friday. TIE is in the process of being acquired by Precision Castparts.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures join the global rally, which has been fueled by hopes of a...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures join the global rally, which has been fueled by hopes of a deal to avert the fiscal cliff. The S&P benchmark is +0.9%. Adding to the good mood are positive earnings from Oracle and FedEx, whose shares +2.9% and +0.8% respectively. GM is +8.3% after it says it's repurchasing $5.5B worth of shares from the government, while Knight Capital is +7.2% on confirmation that it's being bought by Getco. Later: EIA Petroleum Inventories
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • MSA

    Mine Safety Appliances (NYSE:MSA) +2.9% premarket after Jim Cramer suggests the maker of safety...

    Mine Safety Appliances (NYSE:MSA) +2.9% premarket after Jim Cramer suggests the maker of safety products used by workers in the fire service, homeland security, oil and gas, and construction industries as a takeover target. Cramer says the safety industry is consolidating, citing 3M's recent acquisition of Ceradyne.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • PTNR

    Premarket gainers: PTNR +11%. GM +9%. KCG +8%. RMCF +6%. NBG +6%. VRNG +6%. MLNX...

    Premarket gainers: PTNR +11%. GM +9%. KCG +8%. RMCF +6%. NBG +6%. VRNG +6%. MLNX +5%. 
    Losers: ONTY -61%. PLXT -18%. NAV -6%. CYS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar (NYSE:NAV) fall 5.4% premarket after the company's FQ4 report disappoints....

    Shares of Navistar (NYSE:NAV) fall 5.4% premarket after the company's FQ4 report disappoints. Slumping Department of Defense sales helped put a chill into the spines of investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • MKGAF

    Stimuvax, a lung cancer vaccine that Germany's Merck (OTCPK:MKGAF) has licensed from Oncothyreon...

    Stimuvax, a lung cancer vaccine that Germany's Merck (OTCPK:MKGAF) has licensed from Oncothyreon (ONTY), failed to improve overall survival in a Phase III study. However, "notable treatment effects were observed in certain subgroups of patients." That's not enough to convince analysts: "Despite potential positive effects in subgroups, we consider the drug dead," says Deutsche Bank. Oncothyreon collapses 61%, while Merck is -2.9% in Frankfurt. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • GIS

    A beat on its bottom line and a boost in guidance is enough to lift shares of General Mills...

    A beat on its bottom line and a boost in guidance is enough to lift shares of General Mills (NYSE:GIS) up 1.8% in premarket trading. An interesting note to pull out from the company's earnings release is that the products listed as strong contributors to profits - Yoplait Greek Yogurt, Nature Valley protein bars, and Peanut Butter Multigrain Cheerios - all lean to the healthier side.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • F

    Shares of Ford (NYSE:F) trade 1.2% higher in premarket action after rival GM says its will buy...

    Shares of Ford (NYSE:F) trade 1.2% higher in premarket action after rival GM says its will buy back shares from the government.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • GM

    More on General Motors (NYSE:GM): After the automaker buys back 200M shares from Uncle Sam, the...

    More on General Motors (NYSE:GM): After the automaker buys back 200M shares from Uncle Sam, the government will still hold close to 300M shares but has a plan in place to sell off its entire stake within 15 months. GM +7.3% premarket to $27.30.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • GM

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) announces it will spend $5.5B to buy back 200M shares from the U.S....

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) announces it will spend $5.5B to buy back 200M shares from the U.S. Treasury. GM +6.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 26 Comments
  • RMCF

    Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory (NASDAQ:RMCF) gains 17.3% premarket to $12.43 (halted at the...

    Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory (NASDAQ:RMCF) gains 17.3% premarket to $12.43 (halted at the moment) after receiving a buyout offer from PST Capital for $13.50/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM
  • AOBC

    Cowen downgrades Smith & Wesson (SWHC) to Neutral from Outperform. SWHC +2% premarket, after...

    Cowen downgrades Smith & Wesson (SWHC) to Neutral from Outperform. SWHC +2% premarket, after falling close to 19% since the school shooting on Friday.

  • The Nikkei finishes above 10,000 for the first time since April as the yen falls again ahead of...

    The Nikkei finishes above 10,000 for the first time since April as the yen falls again ahead of a BOJ policy decision tomorrow, when the bank is expected to bow to calls from incoming PM Shinzo Abe to ease policy further. Other Asian and European bourses continue to rise on hopes for a deal on the fiscal cliff in the U.S. Japan +2.4%, Hong Kong +0.6%, China flat, India +0.6%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.6%, London +0.4%, Paris +0.5%, Frankfurt +0.2%, Milan +0.8%, Madrid +1.6%.
